name: Paladin Bael

topics.topic: FFPAWhoCan someone in the Citadel train me to wear Power Armor?
topics.topic_text: Can anyone in there teach me how to use power armor?
topics.response_text: Of course. But you'd have to secure the permission of Elder Lyons and well... I just don't see that happening. So move along.
You! You're back! We... We all thought... you know.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the Brotherhood of Steel?
topics.response_text: I can see you're trying to appeal to my good nature. Pity for you I don't have one.
You're standing in front of the Citadel, headquarters to the Brotherhood of Steel. Capital Wasteland detachment.
Negative. No Super Mutants, civilians or traveling salesmen allowed.

topics.topic: TLCitadelSuperMutantCare to share anything about the Super Mutants?
topics.topic_text: Anything about the Super Mutants I should know?
topics.response_text: Yeah, the city ruins are crawling with them. They've pretty much overrun all of old D.C.

conversation.response_text: I'm sorry, ma'am. No unauthorized civilians allowed inside the Citadel. You'll have to leave now.

description:
Paladin Bael is a 42 year-old Caucasian Male.

A seasoned warrior with a stern demeanor and imposing physique, Paladin Bael stands guard at the Citadel's entrance with unwavering vigilance. Clad in distinctive Power Armor bearing the Brotherhood of Steel insignia, his presence alone is enough to deter most would-be intruders. Though not known for his conversational skills, his combat experience and tactical awareness make him a valuable member of the Brotherhood's security detail.

Paladin Bael's Personality: Disciplined, no-nonsense, and fiercely loyal to the Brotherhood of Steel. Bael is inherently suspicious of outsiders and wastelanders, following orders without question. He maintains a professional distance from others, rarely showing emotion beyond stoic determination.

Paladin Bael's Backstory: Born in the Commonwealth, Bael showed an early aptitude for combat and military strategy. He sought out the Brotherhood of Steel as a young adult and proved himself through numerous trials and assignments. Over the years, he earned his Power Armor and eventually rose to the rank of Paladin. His unwavering dedication and imposing presence led to his current assignment as the primary gate guard of the Citadel, a position he has held for several years.
